items.name: Tell Them Who They Are or Should Be

system.description: @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.vbmelu6amDCsv8Xp]{Tell Them Who They Are or Who They Should Be}
@UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.WDtPMAeq3CIumtrg]{Bring an NPC to Rash Decisions and Hard Conclusions}

When marked: The villain tries to avoid harm or escape.

  • Disengage or flee to a safer position.
  • Throw up barriers, screens, or minions.
  • Panic and lash out wildly to clear space.
  • Plead for mercy, bargain, or stall.
  • Hide or go to ground (change the arena).

Immediate use: Make one of these as soon as Afraid is marked, before PCs act again.

When marked: The villain escalates and smashes.

  • Hit back with reckless force.
  • Damage the scene or environment.
  • Shut down talk; refuse to negotiate.
  • Exploit a vulnerability you’ve spotted.
  • Raise the stakes or widen the threat.

When marked: The villain becomes human and conflicted.

  • Seek forgiveness or acceptance.
  • Sacrifice something to make amends.
  • Consider the unthinkable as self‑punishment.
  • Drag others into shared culpability.
  • Reveal their true drive or wound.

When marked: The villain either gives up or goes too far.

  • Concede or pull back from the fight.
  • Burn everything around them.
  • Grab at any flicker of hope or help.
  • Undermine others’ beliefs or morale.
  • Pivot to drastic, terrible measures.

When marked: The villain wavers socially.

  • Double down on a flawed plan.
  • Follow someone else’s lead.
  • Doubt allies; second‑guess the scheme.
  • Admit wrongdoing—out loud.
  • Fade into the background to regroup.

items.name: Tell Them Who They Are or Should Be

system.description: @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.vbmelu6amDCsv8Xp]{Tell Them Who They Are or Who They Should Be}
@UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.WDtPMAeq3CIumtrg]{Bring an NPC to Rash Decisions and Hard Conclusions}

When marked: The villain tries to avoid harm or escape.

  • Disengage or flee to a safer position.
  • Throw up barriers, screens, or minions.
  • Panic and lash out wildly to clear space.
  • Plead for mercy, bargain, or stall.
  • Hide or go to ground (change the arena).

Immediate use: Make one of these as soon as Afraid is marked, before PCs act again.

When marked: The villain escalates and smashes.

  • Hit back with reckless force.
  • Damage the scene or environment.
  • Shut down talk; refuse to negotiate.
  • Exploit a vulnerability you’ve spotted.
  • Raise the stakes or widen the threat.

When marked: The villain either gives up or goes too far.

  • Concede or pull back from the fight.
  • Burn everything around them.
  • Grab at any flicker of hope or help.
  • Undermine others’ beliefs or morale.
  • Pivot to drastic, terrible measures.

When marked: The villain tries to avoid harm or escape.

  • Disengage or flee to a safer position.
  • Throw up barriers, screens, or minions.
  • Panic and lash out wildly to clear space.
  • Plead for mercy, bargain, or stall.
  • Hide or go to ground (change the arena).

Immediate use: Make one of these as soon as Afraid is marked, before PCs act again.

When marked: The villain escalates and smashes.

  • Hit back with reckless force.
  • Damage the scene or environment.
  • Shut down talk; refuse to negotiate.
  • Exploit a vulnerability you’ve spotted.
  • Raise the stakes or widen the threat.

When marked: The villain wavers socially.

  • Double down on a flawed plan.
  • Follow someone else’s lead.
  • Doubt allies; second‑guess the scheme.
  • Admit wrongdoing—out loud.
  • Fade into the background to regroup.

items.name: Tell Them Who They Are or Should Be

system.description: @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.vbmelu6amDCsv8Xp]{Tell Them Who They Are or Who They Should Be}
@UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.WDtPMAeq3CIumtrg]{Bring an NPC to Rash Decisions and Hard Conclusions}

When marked: The villain tries to avoid harm or escape.

  • Disengage or flee to a safer position.
  • Throw up barriers, screens, or minions.
  • Panic and lash out wildly to clear space.
  • Plead for mercy, bargain, or stall.
  • Hide or go to ground (change the arena).

Immediate use: Make one of these as soon as Afraid is marked, before PCs act again.

When marked: The villain either gives up or goes too far.

  • Concede or pull back from the fight.
  • Burn everything around them.
  • Grab at any flicker of hope or help.
  • Undermine others’ beliefs or morale.
  • Pivot to drastic, terrible measures.

When marked: The villain wavers socially.

  • Double down on a flawed plan.
  • Follow someone else’s lead.
  • Doubt allies; second‑guess the scheme.
  • Admit wrongdoing—out loud.
  • Fade into the background to regroup.

system.description: @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.vbmelu6amDCsv8Xp]{Tell Them Who They Are or Who They Should Be}
@UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.WDtPMAeq3CIumtrg]{Bring an NPC to Rash Decisions and Hard Conclusions}

When marked: The villain tries to avoid harm or escape.

  • Disengage or flee to a safer position.
  • Throw up barriers, screens, or minions.
  • Panic and lash out wildly to clear space.
  • Plead for mercy, bargain, or stall.
  • Hide or go to ground (change the arena).

Immediate use: Make one of these as soon as Afraid is marked, before PCs act again.

When marked: The villain escalates and smashes.

  • Hit back with reckless force.
  • Damage the scene or environment.
  • Shut down talk; refuse to negotiate.
  • Exploit a vulnerability you’ve spotted.
  • Raise the stakes or widen the threat.

When marked: The villain becomes human and conflicted.

  • Seek forgiveness or acceptance.
  • Sacrifice something to make amends.
  • Consider the unthinkable as self‑punishment.
  • Drag others into shared culpability.
  • Reveal their true drive or wound.

When marked: The villain either gives up or goes too far.

  • Concede or pull back from the fight.
  • Burn everything around them.
  • Grab at any flicker of hope or help.
  • Undermine others’ beliefs or morale.
  • Pivot to drastic, terrible measures.

When marked: The villain wavers socially.

  • Double down on a flawed plan.
  • Follow someone else’s lead.
  • Doubt allies; second‑guess the scheme.
  • Admit wrongdoing—out loud.
  • Fade into the background to regroup.

When marked: The villain becomes human and conflicted.

  • Seek forgiveness or acceptance.
  • Sacrifice something to make amends.
  • Consider the unthinkable as self‑punishment.
  • Drag others into shared culpability.
  • Reveal their true drive or wound.

When marked: The villain either gives up or goes too far.

  • Concede or pull back from the fight.
  • Burn everything around them.
  • Grab at any flicker of hope or help.
  • Undermine others’ beliefs or morale.
  • Pivot to drastic, terrible measures.

When marked: The villain wavers socially.

  • Double down on a flawed plan.
  • Follow someone else’s lead.
  • Doubt allies; second‑guess the scheme.
  • Admit wrongdoing—out loud.
  • Fade into the background to regroup.

system.description: @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.vbmelu6amDCsv8Xp]{Tell Them Who They Are or Who They Should Be}
@UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.WDtPMAeq3CIumtrg]{Bring an NPC to Rash Decisions and Hard Conclusions}

When marked: The villain tries to avoid harm or escape.

  • Disengage or flee to a safer position.
  • Throw up barriers, screens, or minions.
  • Panic and lash out wildly to clear space.
  • Plead for mercy, bargain, or stall.
  • Hide or go to ground (change the arena).

Immediate use: Make one of these as soon as Afraid is marked, before PCs act again.

When marked: The villain escalates and smashes.

  • Hit back with reckless force.
  • Damage the scene or environment.
  • Shut down talk; refuse to negotiate.
  • Exploit a vulnerability you’ve spotted.
  • Raise the stakes or widen the threat.

When marked: The villain wavers socially.

  • Double down on a flawed plan.
  • Follow someone else’s lead.
  • Doubt allies; second‑guess the scheme.
  • Admit wrongdoing—out loud.
  • Fade into the background to regroup.

When marked: The villain either gives up or goes too far.

  • Concede or pull back from the fight.
  • Burn everything around them.
  • Grab at any flicker of hope or help.
  • Undermine others’ beliefs or morale.
  • Pivot to drastic, terrible measures.

  • Double down on a flawed plan.

When marked: The villain escalates and smashes.

  • Hit back with reckless force.
  • Damage the scene or environment.
  • Shut down talk; refuse to negotiate.
  • Exploit a vulnerability you’ve spotted.
  • Raise the stakes or widen the threat.

When marked: The villain either gives up or goes too far.

  • Concede or pull back from the fight.
  • Burn everything around them.
  • Grab at any flicker of hope or help.
  • Undermine others’ beliefs or morale.
  • Pivot to drastic, terrible measures.

When marked: The villain wavers socially.

  • Double down on a flawed plan.
  • Follow someone else’s lead.
  • Doubt allies; second‑guess the scheme.
  • Admit wrongdoing—out loud.
  • Fade into the background to regroup.

  • Disengage or flee to a safer position.
  • Throw up barriers, screens, or minions.
  • Panic and lash out wildly to clear space.
  • Plead for mercy, bargain, or stall.
  • Hide or go to ground (change the arena).

Immediate use: Make one of these as soon as Afraid is marked, before PCs act again.

When marked: The villain escalates and smashes.

  • Hit back with reckless force.
  • Damage the scene or environment.
  • Shut down talk; refuse to negotiate.
  • Exploit a vulnerability you’ve spotted.
  • Raise the stakes or widen the threat.

When marked: The villain becomes human and conflicted.

  • Seek forgiveness or acceptance.
  • Sacrifice something to make amends.
  • Consider the unthinkable as self‑punishment.
  • Drag others into shared culpability.
  • Reveal their true drive or wound.

items.name: Tell Them Who They Are or Should Be

system.description: @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.vbmelu6amDCsv8Xp]{Tell Them Who They Are or Who They Should Be}
@UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.WDtPMAeq3CIumtrg]{Bring an NPC to Rash Decisions and Hard Conclusions}

When marked: The villain tries to avoid harm or escape.

  • Disengage or flee to a safer position.
  • Throw up barriers, screens, or minions.
  • Panic and lash out wildly to clear space.
  • Plead for mercy, bargain, or stall.
  • Hide or go to ground (change the arena).

Immediate use: Make one of these as soon as Afraid is marked, before PCs act again.

When marked: The villain escalates and smashes.

  • Hit back with reckless force.
  • Damage the scene or environment.
  • Shut down talk; refuse to negotiate.
  • Exploit a vulnerability you’ve spotted.
  • Raise the stakes or widen the threat.

When marked: The villain either gives up or goes too far.

  • Concede or pull back from the fight.
  • Burn everything around them.
  • Grab at any flicker of hope or help.
  • Undermine others’ beliefs or morale.
  • Pivot to drastic, terrible measures.

When marked: The villain becomes human and conflicted.

  • Seek forgiveness or acceptance.
  • Sacrifice something to make amends.
  • Consider the unthinkable as self‑punishment.
  • Drag others into shared culpability.
  • Reveal their true drive or wound.

When marked: The villain either gives up or goes too far.

  • Concede or pull back from the fight.
  • Burn everything around them.
  • Grab at any flicker of hope or help.
  • Undermine others’ beliefs or morale.
  • Pivot to drastic, terrible measures.

When marked: The villain wavers socially.

  • Double down on a flawed plan.
  • Follow someone else’s lead.
  • Doubt allies; second‑guess the scheme.
  • Admit wrongdoing—out loud.
  • Fade into the background to regroup.

When marked: The villain tries to avoid harm or escape.

  • Disengage or flee to a safer position.
  • Throw up barriers, screens, or minions.
  • Panic and lash out wildly to clear space.
  • Plead for mercy, bargain, or stall.
  • Hide or go to ground (change the arena).

Immediate use: Make one of these as soon as Afraid is marked, before PCs act again.

When marked: The villain escalates and smashes.

  • Hit back with reckless force.
  • Damage the scene or environment.
  • Shut down talk; refuse to negotiate.
  • Exploit a vulnerability you’ve spotted.
  • Raise the stakes or widen the threat.

When marked: The villain wavers socially.

  • Double down on a flawed plan.
  • Follow someone else’s lead.
  • Doubt allies; second‑guess the scheme.
  • Admit wrongdoing—out loud.
  • Fade into the background to regroup.

  • Grab at any flicker of hope or help.
  • Undermine others’ beliefs or morale.
  • Pivot to drastic, terrible measures.

When marked: The villain wavers socially.

  • Double down on a flawed plan.
  • Follow someone else’s lead.
  • Doubt allies; second‑guess the scheme.
  • Admit wrongdoing—out loud.
  • Fade into the background to regroup.
